docs.snippet: A Spanish journal by the name of Opiniones Latinoamericanas is 13 months old, and its editor suggests that North American companies would be well advised to consider placing institutional advertising into publications read by Latin Americans.

docs.snippet: An international authority on censorship says that press restrictions have eased in key countries in the 1970's, but that a growing worldwide awareness of human rights has made the situation seem worse than it is.
docs.lead_paragraph: An international authority on censorship says that press restrictions have eased in key countries in the 1970's, but that a growing worldwide awareness of human rights has made the situation seem worse than it is.
docs.abstract: Michael Scammell, founder and publisher of London-based periodical Index on Censorship, says that press restrictions have cased in key countries in '70s, but that growing worldwide awareness of human rights has made situation seem worse than it is (S)

headline.main: Press Curbs Said to Ease In Major Nations in 70's
